answerText: Gaius Valerius Catullus[10] This poet's works include the Monobiblos dedicated to his beloved Cynthia, as well as works on more serious subjects such as the death of the noblewoman Cornelia.
heading: Missiles of October |2011 | 10 | 6 | Literature | Classical | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: Identify the following Roman elegiac poets, for 10 points each: [10] In addition to writing love poems dedicated to Lesbia, this poet also openly criticized political figures like Julius Caesar and bade farewell to his brother in "Ave Atque Vale."
